head.supplied: ¶ [Baron Von ¶ Mueller ¶ has just received a letter from Dr. Von Willemoes-Suhm, of the Challenger expedition, ¶ in reference to oceanic depths between Australia and New Zealand. The soundings hav...

div.p:
Letter not found. The text given here is from the Age (Melbourne), 15 July 1874, p. 2.
[Baron Von Mueller has just received a letter from Dr. Von Willemoes-Suhm, of the Challenger expedition,
M met Willemoes-Suhm when the expedition was in Melbourne; see M to G. Bentham, 21 March 1874. in reference to oceanic depths between Australia and New Zealand. The soundings have gone to enormous depths, proving, as indeed might have been anticipated from the nature of the existing vegetation, that the two countries did not form part of one continent, as supposed by some naturalists; and the same may be said of New Caledonia, around which also oceanic measurements were instituted. Some extraordinary new creatures from the bottom of the sea have on this occasion come to light, including polyzoa of gigantic size and fossil type.]
